lead_paragraph: A gate bearing the Nazi slogan and believed to have been stolen from the concentration camp in 2014 has been found in a suburb of Bergen, Norway.

byline.contributor: Henrik Pryser Libell reported from Oslo, and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.
byline.original: By HENRIK PRYSER LIBELL and MELISSA EDDY

headline.print_headline: Gate Thought to Be From Dachau Is Found
headline.main: ‘Arbeit Macht Frei’ Gate Thought to Be Stolen From Dachau Is Found

snippet: A gate bearing the Nazi slogan and believed to have been stolen from the concentration camp in 2014 has been found in a suburb of Bergen, Norway....
abstract: Wrought iron gate stolen from Dachau concentration camp in southern Germany in 2014 is recovered in suburb of Bergen, Norway; gate, bearing Nazi slogan 'Arbeit Macht Frei,' or 'Work Sets You Free,' was one of most photographed symbols of camp.
